RIGHT UP YOUR STREET.Definition: to be the type of thing that you are interested in or that you enjoy doing

SCRAMBLING.Definition: to move or climb quickly but with difficulty, often using your hands to help you

CONFRONT.Definition: to face, meet, or deal with a difficult situation or person

FRUITLESS.Definition: If an action or attempt to do something is fruitless, it is unsuccessful or produces nothing of value

RATES.Definition: the speed at which something happens or changes, or the amount or number of times it happens or changes in a particular period

RAVAGED.Definition: to cause great damage to something

RANGE.Definition: to have an upper and a lower limit in amount, number, etc.

DIAGNOSE.Definition: to recognise and name the exact character of a disease or a problem, by examining it

NEUTRAL.Definition: not saying or doing anything that would encourage or help any of the groups involved in an argument or war

NEUTRALITY.Definition: a neutral position, especially in a war

MORALE.Definition: the amount of confidence felt by a person or group of people, especially when in a dangerous or difficult situation

TRENCH.Definition: a narrow hole that is dug into the ground

BARBED WIRE.Definition: a type of strong wire with sharp points on it, used to prevent people or animals from entering or leaving a place , especially a field

DIVINE.Definition: connected with a god, or like a god

CREDIBLE.Definition: able to be believed or trusted

STRAIN.Definition: an animal or plant from a particular group whose characteristics are different in some way from others of the same group

BROADLY.Definition: in a general way, without considering specific examples or all the details

BARRACKS.Definition: a building or group of buildings where soldiers live

CONFINEMENT.Definition: the situation in which a person or animal is kept somewhere, usually by force

OVERFLOWING.Definition: When a liquid overflows, it flows over the edges of a container, etc. because there is too much of it

MUTATES.Definition: to change from one thing or type of thing into another

CIVILIAN.Definition: a person who is not a member of the police or the armed forces

MUTATIONS.Definition: the way in which things change and produce permanent differences

CONFINED.Definition: to limit an activity, person, or problem in some way

TEND.Definition: to be likely to behave in a particular way or have a particular characteristic

FRONT LINES.Definition: a place where opposing armies face each other in war and where fighting happens

IMPLEMENTED.Definition: to start using a plan or system

MEASURES.Definition: way of achieving something, or method for dealing with a situation

EPIDEMIOLOGY.Definition: the scientific study of diseases and how they are found, spread, and controlled in groups of people

SQUASH.Definition: to crush something into a flat shape

ERADICATE.Definition: to get rid of something completely or destroy something bad

VACCINE.Definition: a substance containing a virus or bacterium in a form that is not harmful, given to a person or animal to prevent them from getting the disease that the virus or bacterium causes

COORDINATE.Definition: to make many different things work effectively as a whole

COLLABORATION.Definition: to work with someone else for a special purpose

MUNICIPAL.Definition: of or belonging to a town or city

PARALLEL.Definition: something very similar to something else, or a similarity between two things

INGENIOUS.Definition: (of a person) very intelligent and skilful, or (of a thing) skilfully made or planned and involving new ideas and methods

CRAMPED.Definition: not having enough space or time

BOUNCE BACK.Definition: to start to be successful again after a difficult period, for example after experiencing failure, loss of confidence, illness, or unhappiness

REOPEN.Definition: If a place or business, etc. reopens or is reopened, it begins to operate, or it becomes open for people to use, after being closed for a period of time

ULTERIOR.Definition: a secret purpose or reason for doing something

SYMPTOMS.Definition: any feeling of illness or physical or mental change that is caused by a particular disease

MINT.Definition: a sweet tasting of mint (the herb)

ANECDOTE.Definition: a short, often funny story, especially about something someone has done

EQUIPPED.Definition: having the necessary tools, clothes, equipment, etc.
